metadata.title: CVE-2022-4883 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in libXpm. When processing files with .Z or .gzextensions, the library calls external programs to compress and uncompressfiles, relying on the PATH environment variable to find these programs,which could allow a malicious user to execute other programs bymanipulating the PATH environment variable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxpm4 - 1:3.5.12-1ubuntu0.18.04.2
xpmutils - 1:3.5.12-1ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxpm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.5.12-1ubuntu0.18.04.2').
motif: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
